documents.content: A retrospective analysis of telepresence therapy utilization in the Midwest region revealed a 22% increase in claims for speech pathology services among children aged 8-12 between Q3 2022 and Q1 2023. The study noted particular adoption spikes in Ohio following the implementation of the Medicare Coverage Improvement Initiative (MCII-45b). Providers reported reduced no-show rates for rural populations but expressed concerns about reimbursement delays.

BlueCross memo regarding network expansion: Effective October 1, 2023, seventeen new pediatric speech therapy centers will join the Ohio Preferred Network under service code SLP-9087v. This expansion specifically addresses feedback from last year's provider survey highlighting coverage gaps for developmental language disorders in Tier 2 counties.

Telehealth claims processing update: All speech pathology claims filed under benefit category T45-RV12 after 01/15/2023 must include new CPT modifiers for virtual caregiver participation. This change applies to six Midwestern states including Ohio, aligning with CMS remote service documentation requirements.

Community health brief: The Franklin County Children's Initiative published results showing 68% of families accessing speech services preferred hybrid delivery models. The report cites insurance reimbursement policy changes as a key factor enabling this shift, particularly among families with transportation challenges living outside urban centers.
